title: G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) - Physical Science Stream
description: Secure high marks in the Physical Science (Maths) stream. A deep understanding of Physics (especially electricity and magnetism) and Combined Mathematics is crucial for entry into an engineering faculty.

title: BSc Engineering Degree (Electrical)
description: Complete a 4-year BScEng (Hons) degree with a specialization in Electrical Engineering. This degree, accredited by the IESL, covers power systems, electrical machines, and electronics.

title: Graduate Engineer & IESL Associate Membership
description: Start your career as a Graduate Electrical Engineer in sectors like power generation and distribution, construction (MEP), or industrial automation. Register with the IESL as an Associate Member.

title: Achieve Chartered Engineer Status
description: Accumulate at least four years of post-graduate experience, working under the guidance of a Chartered Engineer. Pass the IESL professional review to become a Chartered Engineer (CEng).
institutes: N/A - Based on experience and chartership

title: Senior Electrical Engineer / Consultant
description: Progress to senior roles, managing large-scale electrical projects, leading design teams, or working as a consultant. Specialization in renewable energy, power system protection, or building services is common.
institutes: All major power, energy, and construction companies
